project.name: hardened
project.description: Hardened Gentoo is an official project with the goal of bringing advanced security measures to the Gentoo linux distribution.
project.longdescription: Hardened Gentoo is an umbrella project which oversees the research, implementation, and maintainence of security oriented projects for Gentoo Linux. We are a team of very competent individuals dedicated to bringing advanced security to Gentoo with a number of subprojects.
project.goals: Hardened Gentoo's purpose is to make Gentoo viable for high security, high stability production server environments. This project is not a standalone project disjoined from Gentoo proper; it is intended to be a team of Gentoo developers which are focused on delivering solutions to Gentoo that provide strong security and stability. These solutions will be available in Gentoo once they've been tested for security and stability by the Hardened team.
project.extraproject: Adding SELinux support to Gentoo and Portage, this includes providing kernels with SELinux support, providing patches to userland utilities, writing good Gentoo specific default profiles, and deploying policies via Portage.
Propolice is GCC stack smashing protection written by IBM.
A kernel which provides patches for hardened subprojects, and stability/security oriented patches.
Grsecurity ACL policies and documentation outlining effective use of Grsecurity.
Implementation of PaX Address Space Layout Randomizations using ELF shared objects as executables.

Prelude is a hybrid intrusion detection system that tracks both network intrusions and host intrusions with an lml (log monitoring lackey). Integrating this on a large scale, adding support to certain apps, and adding rules so that lml can monitor other projects like SELinux.

body.p:
The current planned subprojects in Hardened Gentoo are:
Project: Description:
SAL Secure Auditing for Linux. This provides government level secure auditing which can be used to take legal action against attackers. This is a logging system that supports secure, encrypted, protected logs which cannot be modified easily.
Openwall Openwall provides patches to daemons which allow them to be chrooted and add privilege seperation.
Encryption Added algorithms to the unix crypt() function including blowfish and tcb.
Security Forum To provide a place for security oriented projects, like Kerberos, to be hosted, maintained and documented.
Security Documentation There are plans to maintain documentation about best practices, and general security measures such as process limiting, setting quotas, securing systems with kerberos, chrooting, tightening services, et al.
CryptoAPI Cryptographic filesystem support, possibly using FiST.
Bastille Bastille is an interactive app which gives the user suggestions on securing their machine. It will be customized to make suggestions about other Hardened Gentoo subprojects.
IPSec Documentation and ebuilds/patches for using FreeS/WAN with opportunistic encryption and tunneling between networks.

body.p: To participate in the Hardened Gentoo project first join the mailing list at gentoo-hardened@gentoo.org. Then ask if there are plans to support something that you are interested in, propose a new subproject that you are interested in or choose one of the planned subprojects to work on. You may talk to the developers and users in the IRC channel #gentoo-hardened on irc.freenode.net for more information or just to chat about the project or any subprojects. If you don't have the ability to actively help by contributing work we will always need testers to maintain the security and stability of the overall product. All development, testing, and productive comments and feedback will be greatly appreciated.
